page.title: 02SCAMPTON VILLAGE CONTINUED
page.content: Not many children were lucky enough to have a bicycle. Buses were very rare and in those days some were open topped. The bus driver's took butter and eggs to market for the local people. There used to be ponds in Scampton but due to land drainage they have now disappeared. In and on the ponds there used to be Mallard Ducks, Moor-hens and frogs. In the winter there was ice to slide on. The Blacksmith used to shoe farm horses and repair farm machinery he also hooped wheels and sold milk to the villagers in a can. The carpenters made wheels, cabinets and coffins, the cobbler made and repaired shoes. The cobblers shop was also a place to gossip.
